author: al.kc
title: Bringing Cardano to Cambridge
description: Cambridge is a global technology and pharmaceutical cluster including a top ten global university and thriving VC community. As yet Cardano has little consistent presence in this pivotal community

author: jamesarthur
title: Outreach, Education & Collaboration
description: A lack of education regarding Cardano's potential is hindering the development of social and ecologically sustainable use cases in Vienna

author: ddlezu01
title: Cardano Peer Education
description: Many Business and Engineering students got brilliant ideas to impact their society but there is no funding opportunities for these students, therefore Project Catalyst would be ideal.

author: benmahmoudyosr02
title: Cardano for MENA
description: The MENA region is under-represented in the domain of technology due to inaccessibility of information in arabic and the fund shortage which hinders students from developing innovative business ideas

author: benmahmoudyosr02
title: Cardano Tunisia
description: Tunisia is a developing country where ambitious students with innovative business ideas yet with funds shortage are yearning to dive in the blockchain domain yet struggling to find opportunities.

author: benmahmoudyosr02
title: Cardano for Africa
description: Africa is a developing continent where ambitious students with innovative business ideas yet with funds shortage are yearning to dive in the blockchain domain yet struggling to find opportunities.

author: benzvibenjamin
title: International students for Cardano
description: Many Business students have a lot of ideas but they lack tech knowledge how to develop them

author: adamcooke00
title: University Design Team
description: Queen's University, a prominent engineering school in Canada known for its plethora of student-run design teams, does not have a blockchain based design team and are missing this opportunity.

author: rffx
title: Onboard Tanzania Universities
description: How to empower students to other opportunities prior to their educational impediments purpose of improving their soft skills after completion of their studies.

author: quirin.schlegel
title: Mentoring Program
description: Catalyst Newcomers can have a hard time on boarding and navigating the Cardano space, because the Ecosystem is complex and it is not always clear whom you should talk to.

author: keith
title: Create Local/Online Job Fair System
description: There is no representation from Cardano to grant students internships and full-time opportunities.

author: uptodatedevelopers
title: UPDEV CHALLENGE
description: African tech entrepreneurs don't have enough support on their projects to get involved in the Cardano blockchain

author: benzvibenjamin
title: ALOHA for Cardano
description: Many Business students have a lot of ideas but they lack tech knowledge how to develop them

author: jalvarez
title: Thesis on Catalyst Decentralized VC
description: Student entrepreneurs in universities, specially in developing countries, when evaluating possibilities for funding have a limited scope to apply for, and are unaware of new alternatives.

author: otaviolima
title: Cardano Brazil Meetup Hub Students
description: The Cardano community in Brazil is growing rapidly and we need to bring hybrid events to support and interact with our crypto community and college students and universities of Brazil.

author: lendingpond
title: Student Startup escrow (SSE)
description: Students have limited amount of funds and can not risk being scammed by developers and freelancers. There needs to be an consumer protection when young startups outsource jobs and goods.

author: benzvibenjamin
title: Catalyst tournament
description: Business students are unaware of blockchain, they have a lot of business ideas but they do not know how to realize them

author: sensemoneyk2
title: Cardano Catalyst Schooling
description: Most of my peer students are not aware of Cardano blockchain and project catalyst so they can not access project catalyst opportunities. Most of peers are intelligent but idle at home after school.

author: angelanartey00
title: Virtual Assistant
description: One major problem in the blockchain ecosystem is that the females are being left behind in these innovation steps. How do we build female competence to participate in the Cardano ecosystem?

author: gentner.eva
title: OxBAT Conference Oxford University
description: Interdisciplinary exchange between academia, industry, and its participants is lacking, also in the NFT space. Students often don't have access to future peers and are left alone on their path.

author: natdwamena
title: Establish Coin Media
description: The mainstream media provide content and report on bad news in crypto ecosystems. How do we tell our story and present the amazing real-world impact made in the Cardano ecosystem?

author: galsen19
title: Digitalization of town halls
description: In Senegal,city administrators have great difficulty receiving or recovering their administrative documents in the event of an emergency or in the event of need without having to travel

author: kingsleygemini45
title: Cardano Student Learning Platform
description: A large percentage of students in my school and other tertiary Institutions are not aware of Cardano blockchain and project catalyst. Some students have great excellent ideas but no knowledge about it

author: gilvania
title: Cardano for STEM Brazilian students
description: There is a lack of courses on blockchain in Brazilian Universities leaving our students out of these technological advances. Most educational contents are in English, but Brazilians speak Portuguese.

author: minhbuivsc2
title: 🇻🇳 Cardano Catalyst Student VSC2O
description: Vietnamese students' lack of Blockchain knowledge and approaches to funding organisation is an obstacle that prevents them from developing projects, research and start-ups.

author: sustainableada
title: Youth Block Resource Development
description: Schools are failing to equip youth with the skills to access networks, navigate, and flourish in a globalized digital economy. An education for sustainable development Cardano Youth program is absent.

author: tduneau
title: Fund Winner Marketing Logos
description: Catalyst fund winners do not have ready-made visuals to showcase their win. Catalyst does not make the most of winner’s communication to the outside world.

author: tevosaks
title: Mini Proposal Workshops
description: Proposers don't have the experience to make their proposals understandable to voters.

author: defidiscussions
title: Outreach/Education Ecuador
description: A lack of education regarding Cardano's potential in local Ecuadorian communities is hindering the development of the cardano ecosystem in Ecuador

author: adaku
title: Black & PhD: Writing retreat for PC
description: Young black entrepreneurs get less business funding than their counterparts. Lack of opportunity for these groups is problematic. Project Catalyst is a great way for Black PhD’s to grow businesses.

author: defidiscussions
title: Outreach/Education Paraguay
description: A lack of education regarding Cardano's potential in local Paraguayan communities is hindering the development of the cardano ecosystem in Paraguay

author: xyzzy
title: ADAO Learning Grant
description: There are very few resources available for students to develop practical skills on Cardano. The blockchain is in need of student workers.

author: ov3rd0z
title: Student and engineers community
description: Student entrepreneurs have exciting ideas for starting a business but often face the problem of lack of funds and qualified engineers to help them materialize their ideas and projects.

author: lilamacdaniel
title: Cardano for Latinamerican Students
description: Low-income students across Latin America are ostracized from global technological innovation such as Cardano blockchain due to underdeveloped educational resources.

author: mustapha
title: Catalyst for MBA Students.
description: There is a no reliable open fundraising platform for student entrepreneurs nor a business incubator for students to access free resources so they can successfully start and grow their businesses.
